adaptive_cruise_control.title: Using Adaptive Cruise Control
steps: Start the vehicle and reach a minimum speed (typically above 30 km/h).
Locate the cruise control buttons on the steering wheel.
Press the 'Cruise' or 'On' button to activate the system.
Use the 'Set' button to fix the current speed.
Adjust the following distance using the distance control button (usually marked with a car icon).
To cancel, press the brake or the 'Cancel' button. To resume, press 'Resume'.

lane_keep_assist.title: Using Lane Keep Assist
steps: Ensure the system is enabled in the vehicle settings.
Start driving on a clearly marked road with visible lane lines.
The system activates automatically above a certain speed (e.g., 60 km/h).
If you begin to drift without signaling, the system will gently steer to keep the vehicle in the lane.
Look for the indicator light (usually a steering wheel icon) on the dashboard to confirm activation.

auto_parking.title: Using Automatic Parking
steps: Drive slowly near a row of parked cars and press the 'Auto Park' button.
The system will scan for a suitable parking space.
Once a space is found, follow the on-screen instructions.
Control the accelerator and brake as instructed; the steering is handled automatically.
Wait until the system confirms parking is complete before releasing the controls.

rear_view_camera.title: Using the Rear View Camera
steps: Shift the gear into 'Reverse'.
The rear view camera display will automatically appear on the infotainment screen.
Use the on-screen guidelines to align your vehicle while backing up.
Watch for obstacles, and don’t rely solely on the camera—always check your surroundings.

bluetooth_pairing.title: Pairing a Device via Bluetooth
steps: Turn on Bluetooth on your phone.
On the car's infotainment system, go to the Bluetooth settings menu.
Select 'Add Device' or 'Pair New Device'.
Find the car's name on your phone's Bluetooth list and select it.
Confirm the pairing code shown on both devices.
Once paired, you can make calls or stream music through the car’s system.

adaptive_headlights.title: Using Adaptive Headlights
steps: Ensure the headlights are set to 'Auto' mode.
The system will automatically adjust the headlight direction based on steering input and vehicle speed.
For manual adjustment, use the headlight control stalk to position the beams as needed.

blind_spot_monitoring.title: Using Blind Spot Monitoring
steps: Activate the system via the vehicle settings menu.
Indicators will light up in the side mirrors when a vehicle is detected in the blind spot.
If you signal to change lanes while a vehicle is in the blind spot, an audible alert will sound.

automatic_high_beams.title: Using Automatic High Beams
steps: Set the headlight control to 'Auto' mode.
The system will automatically switch between high and low beams based on oncoming traffic and ambient light.
If manual control is needed, use the headlight stalk to adjust the beams.

rain_sensing_wipers.title: Using Rain Sensing Wipers
steps: Set the wiper control to 'Auto' mode.
The system will detect rain intensity and adjust wiper speed accordingly.
To deactivate, switch the wiper control to 'Off' or 'Manual' mode.

keyless_entry.title: Using Keyless Entry
steps: Ensure the key fob is within range of the vehicle.
Press the button on the door handle to unlock the doors.
To lock, press the button again after exiting the vehicle.

push_button_start.title: Using Push Button Start
steps: Ensure the key fob is inside the vehicle.
Press the brake pedal and push the 'Start/Stop' button to start the engine.
To turn off, press the 'Start/Stop' button again while the vehicle is in 'Park' mode.

panoramic_sunroof.title: Using the Panoramic Sunroof
steps: Locate the sunroof control switch, usually on the overhead console.
Press and hold the 'Open' button to tilt or slide the sunroof back.
To close, press and hold the 'Close' button.
For ventilation, press the 'Tilt' button to raise the rear edge.

auto_dimming_mirrors.title: Using Auto Dimming Mirrors
steps: Ensure the vehicle is in 'Drive' mode.
The rearview and side mirrors will automatically dim to reduce glare from headlights behind you.
To deactivate, press the 'Auto' button on the mirror.

heads_up_display.title: Using the Heads-Up Display
steps: Activate the system through the vehicle settings menu.
Adjust the display position and brightness using the controls provided.
The display will show key information like speed, navigation, and warnings on the windshield.

voice_recognition.title: Using Voice Recognition
steps: Press the voice command button on the steering wheel.
Wait for the prompt and speak your command, such as 'Navigate to [destination]' or 'Call [contact name]'.
Follow any additional prompts as needed.

wireless_charging.title: Using Wireless Charging
steps: Place your Qi-compatible device on the designated charging pad, usually located in the center console.
Ensure the device is properly aligned with the charging coils.
A charging indicator will appear on the device screen once charging begins.

adaptive_air_suspension.title: Using Adaptive Air Suspension
steps: Access the suspension settings through the vehicle's infotainment system.
Select the desired ride height: 'Low', 'Normal', or 'High'.
The system will automatically adjust the suspension height based on the selected mode and driving conditions.
Use 'Low' for better aerodynamics and high-speed driving.
Use 'High' for increased ground clearance in rough or off-road conditions.
Return to 'Normal' for everyday driving comfort.
The system may auto-adjust when entering highways or rough terrain if set to adaptive mode.
